clinical_study.brief_title: Major Liver Resection: Early Clotting Disorders and Functional Impairment.
clinical_study.official_title: Hypercoagulability and Liver Function After Major Liver Resection

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate early clotting disorders through thromboelastogram and anticoagulant proteins levels (maybe also endothelial markers) and liver function by indocyanine green clearance after major liver resection and search for a potential relationship between them.

primary_outcome.measure: Establish a relationship between ICG and MCF
primary_outcome.description: We aim to find a potential association between ICG and MCF measured by thromboelastometry in the first week after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Establish a relationship between pro and anticoagulant proteins levels and endothelial markers
primary_outcome.description: We aim to find a potential association between procoagulant factor levels, protein C,S and ATIII with thrombomodulin, heparan sulfate and syndecan-1 in the first week after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Study blood coagulation disorders after major liver surgery resection
secondary_outcome.description: We aim to characterize blood coagulation disorders during the first week after major liver surgery in our sample of patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Study liver function after major liver surgery
secondary_outcome.description: We aim to study the predictive value of indocyanine green clearance for liver impairment after major liver surgery in our sample of patients

arm_group.description: Patients that have hyper, normo o hypcoagulability measured by tromboelastometry and anticoagulant proteins levels early after major liver resection and clinical evolution and patients with liver funcion impairment or without it, measured by indocyanine green clearance early after surgery and clinical evolution

intervention.description: To evaluate liver function by injection of indocyanine green by a peripheral vein and measure its clearance
To evaluate blood coagulation impairment by obtaining blood sample from a peripheral vein and measure anticoagulant proteins levels plus obtaining thromboelastometry

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples for anticoagulant proteins levels analysis and thromboelastometry

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing major liver surgery defined as resection of 3 or more hepatic segments

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing major liver surgery defined as resection of 3 or more hepatic segments
Exclusion Criteria:
- Indocyanin green allergy
- Thyrotoxicosis
- Thrombophilia
- Lupus anticoagulant
- Coagulation factor deficiency
- Venous thromboembolism in the last 3 years
- Pulmonary thromboembolism in the last 3 years
